title: The Careful Use of Compliments
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: Around it, though, was the Edinburgh with which Isabel was more familiar – the stone tenement buildings, the predominant note of grey. She walked up Home  Street, past the vegetable shops, the watchmaker, the sellers of cheap ornaments,  the bars. She passed the King's Theatre and Bennet's Bar beside it,  with  its elaborate  stained-glass windows,  where singers and musicians would meet after rehearsals in the theatre, sitting on the long red benches, reflected in the large brewers' mirrors.
